citation.article-title: Deoxyribonucleic acid relatedness among major human enterococci.

p.s: Description of Streptococcus durans sp. nov.
Streptococcus durans (originally named by Sherman and Wing in 1934 for its tolerance to heat and desiccation)
The organisms are gram-positive cocci that occur in pairs or chains of varying length (usually less than six cells).
After 24 h of growth in 5 to 10% CO2 on Trypticase soy agar supplemented with 5% sheep blood, colonies are 1 to 2 mm in diameter with a small zone of beta- or alphahemolysis.
Growth occurs in the presence of 6.5% NaCl and in the presence of 40% bile.
Mannitol, sorbitol, sucrose, and arabinose are not fermented, but lactose is fermented.
Clot formation occurs in litmus milk.
Lancefield Group D antigen is expressed.
The DNA base composition is 36 mol% G+C.
DNA relatedness show that this taxon is separate from S. faecium and S. faecalis.
The proposed type strain is strain ATCC 19432.
